questionText: What does HTML stand for?
explanation: HTML stands for Hyper Text Markup Language. It is the standard markup language for creating web pages and defining their structure and content.

questionText: What does the <!DOCTYPE html> declaration do at the beginning of an HTML document?
options: Tells the browser this is HTML5
explanation: <!DOCTYPE html> declares that the document uses HTML5 standards, ensuring the browser renders the page correctly. It must be the first line in an HTML document.

questionText: Where does the visible content of a webpage go in an HTML document?
explanation: The <body> section contains all visible content including text, images, links, and other elements. The <head> contains metadata, while <html> is the root element that wraps everything.

questionText: What attribute is used to specify the destination URL of a hyperlink in an <a> tag?
explanation: The 'href' (hypertext reference) attribute specifies the link destination. Example: Click here. The 'src' attribute is used for images and scripts.

questionText: What is the purpose of the 'id' attribute in HTML?
options: To style multiple elements with the same styles
To create a unique identifier for a single element
To add comments to the HTML
explanation: The 'id' attribute creates a unique identifier for ONE element on the page. It's used for targeting with CSS, JavaScript, or anchor links. Each id value must be unique on the page.

questionText: Which attribute is used to apply one or more CSS classes to an HTML element?
explanation: The 'class' attribute applies CSS classes to elements. Multiple elements can share the same class, and one element can have multiple classes. Example: <div class="container highlight">.

questionText: Where should the <title> tag be placed in an HTML document?
explanation: The <title> tag goes in the <head> section and defines the page title shown in the browser tab and search results. Example: <head><title>My Website</title></head>

questionText: What is the correct and most commonly used file extension for HTML documents?
explanation: While both .htm and .html are valid, .html is the standard and preferred extension for HTML files. The .htm extension is a legacy from older systems with 3-character extension limits.

questionText: Which tag is used to create the largest heading size in HTML?
explanation: <h1> creates the largest heading and represents the main title. Headings go from <h1> (largest) to <h6> (smallest). There should typically be only one <h1> per page for proper SEO.

questionText: What attribute specifies the source file path or URL for an image?
explanation: The 'src' (source) attribute specifies the image file location. Example: . The 'href' attribute is used for links.

explanation: is a self-closing tag that creates a line break, moving content to the next line without starting a new paragraph. It's useful for addresses or poetry.

questionText: What is the default homepage filename that web servers look for in a directory?
explanation: Most web servers automatically serve 'index.html' when someone visits a directory URL. For example, visiting 'example.com/' serves 'example.com/index.html' by default.

questionText: Which attribute and value opens a link in a new browser tab or window?
explanation: target='_blank' opens the link in a new tab/window. Example: Open in new tab. Other target values include _self (same tab) and _parent.

questionText: What is the correct HTML comment syntax?
explanation: HTML comments use <!-- comment -->. They're invisible to users but visible in the source code. // is for JavaScript, /* */ for CSS, and # for Python/other languages.
